name: The Oberoi, Bangalore

reviews.text: Bangalore used to be the calm garden city where everyone wanted to live. The software boom and the population explosion put paid to that. But the sanctuary of the Oberoi garden is still something special. All the bedrooms look out over the magnificent trees and there are flowers around all the balconies encouraging butterflies to come and linger. Sadly they can't shut out modern Bangalore completely. High rise blocks increasingly intrude on the skyline and they have had to glass in the open air corridors to cut down the traffic noise. But no doubt this is an oasis. They have also modernised the rooms since my last visit - without losing the colonial ambiance. The rooms have been a bit over teched. Everything is now controlled via an iPad. Quite why you want to control your air conditioning form an iPad that is actually sitting next to the control switch on the wall I don't know. The food is great here and the staff are fabulous. It is a place I will come back to.
reviews.title: Impeccable service. Wonderful trees.

reviews.text: A truly brilliant hotel. Starting from the way you're greeted by the staff to the room and facilities to the food. Its just pure brilliance. Extremely comfortable beds. Very well maintained rooms and bathrooms. an iPad to control the whole room was indeed very impressive. The variety in breakfast was exceptional and delicious as well.
reviews.title: Exceptionally Amazing

reviews.text: And it is situated in the perfect location. Right on MG Road. Everything is right close by!!
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.text: I would say everything was perfect during the stay and would definitely recommend this place for people looking for an amazing experience
reviews.title: Exceptional

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights over my birthday weekend. The staff went above and beyond to make sure my stay was wonderful. You're greeted with smiles every morning from the second you leave your room. If anything can pull you from the plush beds, it's the breakfast buffet. From fresh fruit and juice to delectable pancakes and an extensive Indian selection, breakfast must be done in no less than 6 courses. Their other restaurants and room service menu are also extensive and delicious. Every detail of my stay was perfect- from the welcome juice and soothing spa to the Bon voyage chocolate cake and relaxing garden setting- the Oberoi couldn't be a more perfect retreat from the crazy, hectic, sometimes overwhelming city of Bangalore a few feet beyond the gates of the hotel.
reviews.title: Very kind staff - filtered tap water

reviews.text: This is one of the best places I have stayed at. By the second day everyone I interacted with knew be by name. Even staff that I had not interacted with directly the day before. Also, they got to know my schedule and had my needs ready before I knew I needed them. The service was over the top. The hotel was updated and beautiful as others have mentioned in the reviews. I felt very safe here and the restaurants were top quality, and good variety. The Hotel drivers were fantastic. They did a great job of transporting me where I needed quickly and safely. I very much enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: India has all those fabled tales of hospitality, and some of India's famed hotels are determined to showcase it. When the two meet - albeit rarely - guests can expect a stay that is picture perfect in every way.
reviews.title: Feel like royalty

reviews.text: My recent stay at the Oberoi Bangalore has reaffirmed my faith in the group's exemplary service standards. The concierge went out of her way to book and negotiate rates for a private taxi. The housekeeping staff not only provided every bottle of water and towel that was requested in mere minutes, but gave me a rather handsome gift - just for the pleasure of looking after me. At breakfast, they remembered my choices for three days in a row. (Try the South Indian coffee and order a Dosa Platter for a true taste of Bangalore).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

reviews.text: I have visited their Thai restaurant many years ago, but chose the room service route this time. The signature dishes were worthy of singing over, and the lotions and potions in the bathroom are worthy of taking home. Everything you need inside the room is on a customised iPad, so if it is a relaxing time you are after, you don't even need to leave the bed. But please do...
reviews.title: Perfect stay in true 5 star hotel

reviews.text: The property is centrally located, but unless you are ensconced inside, you would not know of its charming gardens, replete with mini waterfall, majestic trees, pebbled pathways and peppy yellow garden chairs. Look for the water lilies
reviews.title: The absolute best in Bangalore!

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel twice now and will return here on every trip to Bangalore.
reviews.title: Great rooms,Amazing food and Service above and beyond

reviews.text: The executive rooms have Ipads that control everything in the room. The personal butler is so helpful and available for all your needs.
reviews.title: Great location and wonderful service. Food is amazing!

reviews.text: The spa was wonderful, the fitness center met all my needs and great equipment. Spent a few hours at the pool, great service and relaxing.
reviews.title: Outstanding service, lovely grounds

reviews.text: The food at the restaurants is exemplary. Chef Gautam is willing to help any diet needs and go above and beyond to please all his guests.
reviews.title: Nice full service hotel in Bangalore

reviews.text: The food and beverage director Shashank makes a point to follow up with customers dining experience while you are there. Which shows such devotion to great service!
reviews.title: A nice place to stay in the middle of the city

reviews.text: I stayed at The Oberoi, in Bangalore for 5 nights. I was in Bangalore on business and this was the first time I had been back to India in more than 10 years, and nearly 13 years since I last visited the Oberoi.
reviews.title: Pure Luxury

reviews.text: My experience was incredible. The one thing the Oberoi group knows how to do consistently is luxury and service. In fact, I believe it is the highly professional and friendly staff that make this luxury hotel group arguably, the best luxury hotel chain in the world.
reviews.title: Value for money luxury.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived on Saturday early morning and I was welcomed by the front office staff and immediately taken to my room. The hotel had already processed check-in formalities before I had even arrived, so there was no waiting around (I was tired from 13 hours of travelling). My room was exquisite. The hotel has upgraded many rooms and these all look out towards the luscious green gardens and pool area of the hotel. The rooms are beautifully decorated in a colonial style with tasteful flower and fruit arrangements (mangos in my case). All room amenities are controlled through an IPAD that can be found in the room: air conditioning, lights, TV, privacy screen, room service, Internet etc.
reviews.title: Simply outstanding

reviews.text: Now for the legendary service! On Saturday afternoon I went down to the concierge desk, which was being managed by a lovely lady called Kanchan. I explained to Kanchan that my company was looking to open an office in Bangalore and that I wanted to find out more about the city. As a good concierge, she explained where the good areas were and arranged for a hotel car to take me around the city. What I didn’t expect was what I found when I returned to my hotel room. Kanchan, using her own initiative had gone and brought me a beautifully illustrated book on the history of Bangalore, which I found on my room table. Accompanying the book was a sincere and personal message from Kanchan welcoming me to the city and hoping the book would help me find out more about the city. I was blown away!
reviews.title: Oh my God

reviews.text: This is what the Oberoi do best and that is customer service beyond the usual generic ‘ticking boxes’ stuff found at most luxury hotel chains. And was my experience a one off? No. 13 years ago I visited the Oberoi in Bangalore and at that time there were only a hand full of luxury hotels in the city. The hotel could not find my reservation when I tried to check-in and the hotel was full. Instead of making an excuse or blaming my travel agent, they just escorted me to the Presidential Suite, which I duly enjoyed for the next three days!
reviews.title: Excellent service, scrumptious food...very pleasant stay

description: A modern &charming hotel with landscaped garden & water bodies, in the heart of business & shopping district.
